availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Adair County attorney. Married Susan Agnes Elder Russell in 1854. Father of Sylvester A. Russell and Marietta Russell. Held six slaves in 1860. Studied law in Adair County from 1848 to 1849. Admitted to the bar in 1849. Adair County Representative from 1857 to 1858.

bibl.p: E. Polk Johnson, A History of Kentucky and Kentuckians: The Leaders and Representative Men in Commerce, Industry, and Modern Activities (Chicago, IL: Lewis Publishing Company, 1912), volume 3, p. 1270-1271. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, p. 89. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Division 2, p. 9. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 86.
